definition: knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
lay down butcher's knife, become a Buddha on the spot (idiom); instant rehabilitation/to repent and be absolved of one's crimes
pinyin: fang4 xia4 tu2 dao1 , li4 di4 cheng2 fo2

sentences.english: The imperialists will never lay down their butcher knives.
sentences.chinese: 帝国主义分子决不肯放下屠刀。

sentences.english: We knew these people would never lay down their butcher knives.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道这些人决不会放下屠刀。

sentences.english: My master waits and holds a knife.
sentences.chinese: 主人的屠刀闪亮亮要宰我的羊。

sentences.english: But no animal escapes the cruel knife in the end.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有动物能逃过最终那残忍的屠刀。

sentences.english: So Ben butchers in the past rely on the straw heap below, pick up the butcher's knife lay down their burden.
sentences.chinese: 屠户于是奔过去倚靠在柴草堆下，放下担子拿起屠刀。

sentences.english: Only love can win improbity , and it makes devil give up hatred and revenge.
sentences.chinese: 只有爱才能战胜邪恶，令恶魔放下复仇的屠刀。

sentences.english: The imperialists will never lay down their butcher knives of their own accord.
sentences.chinese: 帝国主义分子决不会自动放下屠刀。

sentences.english: Ladies may stay at home, away from the blood of battle and the heat of war.
sentences.chinese: 女人可以待在家里，远离战争的屠刀和热火。

sentences.english: A butcher can become a Buddha after laying down the knife.
sentences.chinese: 宰杀猪羊的屠夫，因放下屠刀，立地成佛。

sentences.english: So, the butcher's knife with final Microsoft must go to cereal song brandish .
sentences.chinese: 所以，微软最终的屠刀必须向谷歌挥去。

definition: lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
ghost of one who died unjustly/departed spirit demanding vengeance for grievances
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
debts of blood crying out for retribution
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
to massacre everyone in a captured city
jackal and wolf/ravenous wolf/fig. evil person/vicious tyrant
